action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I will start by guessing a common five-letter English word to get an initial sense of the letters involved.
guess: house

attempts = 1
target_word = today
guess = house
guess_feedback = h<red> o<green> u<red> s<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: h<red> o<green> u<red> s<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "o" is correct and in the correct position, while the letters "h", "u", "s", and "e" are incorrect. I will use this information to form a new guess that includes "o" as the second letter and avoids the other letters.
guess: coach

attempts = 2
target_word = today
guess = coach
guess_feedback = c<red> o<green> a<yellow> c<red> h<red>

guess_feedback: c<red> o<green> a<yellow> c<red> h<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "o" remains in the correct position, and "a" is a correct letter but in the wrong position. I will form a new guess that includes "o" as the second letter, includes "a" in a different position, and avoids the letters "c", "h".
guess: boast

attempts = 3
target_word = today
guess = boast
guess_feedback = b<red> o<green> a<yellow> s<red> t<yellow>

guess_feedback: b<red> o<green> a<yellow> s<red> t<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "o" is still in the correct position, "a" is correct but not in the right position, and "t" is also a correct letter but not in the right position. I will form a new guess that includes "o" as the second letter, includes "a" and "t" in different positions, and avoids the letters "b", "s".
guess: toast

attempts = 4
target_word = today
guess = toast
guess_feedback = t<green> o<green> a<yellow> s<red> t<red>

guess_feedback: t<green> o<green> a<yellow> s<red> t<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "t" and "o" are now in the correct positions, and "a" is still a correct letter but not in the right position. I will form a new guess that keeps "t" as the first letter and "o" as the second letter, includes "a" in a different position, and avoids the letter "s".
guess: trope

attempts = 5
target_word = today
guess = trope
guess_feedback = t<green> r<red> o<yellow> p<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: t<green> r<red> o<yellow> p<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "t" is still in the correct position, "o" is a correct letter but not in the correct position as previously thought. I will re-evaluate the position of "o" and form a new guess that keeps "t" as the first letter, includes "o" in a different position, and avoids the letters "r", "p", "e".
guess: tonal

attempts = 6
target_word = today
guess = tonal
guess_feedback = t<green> o<green> n<red> a<green> l<red>

guess_explanation: I will start by guessing a common five-letter English word to get an initial sense of the letters involved.

The letter "o" is correct and in the correct position, while the letters "h", "u", "s", and "e" are incorrect. I will use this information to form a new guess that includes "o" as the second letter and avoids the other letters.

The letter "o" remains in the correct position, and "a" is a correct letter but in the wrong position. I will form a new guess that includes "o" as the second letter, includes "a" in a different position, and avoids the letters "c", "h".

The letter "o" is still in the correct position, "a" is correct but not in the right position, and "t" is also a correct letter but not in the right position. I will form a new guess that includes "o" as the second letter, includes "a" and "t" in different positions, and avoids the letters "b", "s".

The letters "t" and "o" are now in the correct positions, and "a" is still a correct letter but not in the right position. I will form a new guess that keeps "t" as the first letter and "o" as the second letter, includes "a" in a different position, and avoids the letter "s".

The letter "t" is still in the correct position, "o" is a correct letter but not in the correct position as previously thought. I will re-evaluate the position of "o" and form a new guess that keeps "t" as the first letter, includes "o" in a different position, and avoids the letters "r", "p", "e".
